'The Dude' Jeff Bridges' Glorious Golden Globes Speech Gets A Big Thumbs Up From The Internet!
'The Dude' Jeff Bridges' Glorious Golden Globes Speech Gets A Big Thumbs Up From The Internet!
Jeff Bridges became the recipient of the Cecil B. DeMille Award at the 2019 Golden Globes on Sunday night. The actor invoked his most iconic role "The Dude" as he accepted this year's Cecil B DeMille Award for career achievement at the Golden Globes.
Apart from his victory, it was his 'dude' speech that made everyone root for him.
He was also presented with the honor by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association, which was bestowed upon presenter-actor Oprah Winfrey last year.
Agencies
The 69-year-old actor gave a rambling and emotional speech in which he expressed gratitude to the directors who have influenced his career, author Buckminster Fuller and his family, including wife Susan Geston, brother Beau and sister Cindy. He even spoke about the planet and everything else that crossed his mind.
In his speech, he revealed a special tribute to his father, actor Lloyd Bridges. "Wearing your cuffs, dads," he said. "Wearing your cuff links." He further thanked his brother, fellow actor Beau Bridges, and sister Cindy, saying how "lucky" they were to have their parents, Lloyd and Dorothy.
Thanking his wife, he said,
Agencies
"I gotta thank my sweetheart, Sue. My god, 45 years of support and love, I wouldn't be up here without you me dear."
But the highlight of the speech was when he thanked the film's writer-directors Joel and Ethan Cohen for creating the iconic role. said,
Don't Miss 12.5 K SHARES 5.5 K SHARES 3.4 K SHARES 3.1 K SHARES 2.5 K SHARES
Agencies
"If I’m lucky I’ll be associated with The Dude for the rest of my life."
In Bridges' speech, he included "trim tabs" on ocean liners that hinted at all the possibilities of how individuals can make a difference.
In his address, Bridges likened his life and career to that of a trim tab -- a small feature on boats and airplanes that assists in controlling the direction of the vessel. "I like to think of myself as trim tab, and all of us trim tabs," he said. "We may not seem like we're up to the task, but we are. We're alive! We can make a difference. We can turn this ship in the way we want to go, toward love, toward creating a healthy planet for all of us," he added.
Joining the list of recipients of Cecil B. DeMille Award like Walt Disney, Judy Garland, Frank Sinatra, Elizabeth Taylor, Robin Williams, Meryl Streep and last year's honoree, Oprah Winfrey, this one's surely a big achievement.
Needless to say, his speech got a big thumbs up from the audience.
